address: Xã Dân Hòa, Huyện Thanh Oai, Thành phố Hà Nội
thought:
**Analyzing the Administrative Restructuring of Xã Dân Hòa**

Okay, so the task is to pinpoint the new administrative unit, the "ward," for the old address "Xã Dân Hòa, Huyện Thanh Oai, Thành phố Hà Nội."  I need to meticulously review the provided resolutions and the list of newly formed wards. My strategy is straightforward: first, I'll identify the old ward and province. Then, I'll systematically examine the relevant resolutions to see if "Xã Dân Hòa" is mentioned in any merger scenarios. Finally, I will cross-reference the findings with the "New wards" list.

Initially, I've identified the old ward as "Xã Dân Hòa" and the old province as "Thành phố Hà Nội." Consulting the province resolutions (60-NQ/TW), I see that "Thành phố Hà Nội" isn't slated for any mergers or name changes, keeping the same name.

Moving on to the other resolutions, I focused on 1656/NQ-UBTVQH15, the one related to Hà Nội. After reviewing the lines, line 67 catches my eye. It specifically states that "Xã Dân Hòa" (along with other existing communes) will form a new commune named "Xã Dân Hòa." Notably, the old name persists in the new administrative structure, but the composition will be different. It indicates a total merger of existing communes into this new Xã Dân Hòa. Other resolutions aren't relevant, since they pertain to other provinces.

Now, I cross-reference this information with the "New wards" list and, indeed, I find an entry: `{"ward_code":"10180","ward_name":"Xã Dân Hòa ","province_name":"Thành phố Hà Nội"}`.  It's the new "Xã Dân Hòa" in "Thành phố Hà Nội", confirming my findings from the resolution. Thus, the corresponding new ward is the "Xã Dân Hòa".

citation.header: 1656/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của thành phố Hà Nội
citation.line: 67. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Cao Xuân Dương, Hồng Dương, Liên Châu, Tân Ước và Dân Hòa thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Dân Hòa.
